PvSTATEM 0.0.1
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Simple example of basic PvSTATEM package pre-release version functionalities

    Sample

    Sample.Rd

    A class to represent the sample. It contains all the necessary information about the sample

    Public fields

    id

    Sample id, when reading from a plate it is a id extracted from the sample position on the plate

    sample_name

    Sample name

    sample_type

    A sample type - is the sample used for testing, is it blank, positive or negative control

    sample_location

    Position on the Plate

    warnings

    list of warnings warnings are read from the file or generated during the reading process

    errors

    lit of errors; errors are read from the file or generated during the reading process

    data

    The dataframe containing informations about the analytes within the sample. The dataframe rows are different measures, such as Median, Net MFI, etc. whereas the columns represent different analytes

    Methods

    Public methods

    • Sample$new()

    • Sample$print()

    • Sample$join()

    • Sample$clone()

    Method new()

    Initializes the sample object

    Usage

    Sample$new(
  id,
  sample_name,
  sample_type = NULL,
  sample_location = NULL,
  warnings = list(),
  errors = list(),
  data = data.frame()
)

    Arguments

    id

    (numeric(1))
    The id of the sample - usually just the sample row number, can be derived from the sample location

    sample_name

    (character(1))
    The name of the sample

    sample_type

    (SampleType)
    The type of the sample

    The location of the sample on the plate

    warnings

    (list)
    List containing all the warnings connected to the sample - generated by the validity checks or read from file

    errors

    (list)
    List containing all the critical errors connected to the sample - generated by the validity checks or read from file

    data

    (data.frame)
    The dataframe containing the informations about analytes within the sample

    Method print()

    Prints the sample information

    Usage

    Sample$print(...)

    Method join()

    Joins the data of two samples

    Usage

    Sample$join(new_sample)

    Method clone()

    The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

    Usage

    Sample$clone(deep = FALSE)

    Arguments

    deep

    Whether to make a deep clone.
